title: Cook with Maido's creative chef and chef de cuisine
description: Master the professional techniques for creating the perfect ceviche, pisco sour, and other Peruvian classics during a small-group cooking class led by a former star chef at a Michelin-starred restaurant. Under the careful guidance of your expert instructor, you’ll prepare a traditional 3-course meal. Possible dishes include lomo saltado, aji de gallina, and shrimp causa.
all_descriptions: Master the professional techniques for creating the perfect ceviche, pisco sour, and other Peruvian classics during a small-group cooking class led by a former star chef at a Michelin-starred restaurant. Under the careful guidance of your expert instructor, you’ll prepare a traditional 3-course meal. Possible dishes include lomo saltado, aji de gallina, and shrimp causa.
ItineraryYou'll experience an honest culinary and .cultural immersion with the famous chef Hector known for his work as the creative chef at Maido. The best restaurant in the world 2025.
Ca. Gral. Borgoño 712, Miraflores 15074, PeruIf you need us to organize your transportation let us know and we will help you tk make it easier
End:This activity ends back at the meeting point.
provider:

reviews.title: Amazing experience!
reviews.text: We had a great time with Hector. We started in the market and gave us his insights on Peruvian cuisine And how he chooses ingredients.We then had the class and it was great to learn new techniques and how to use ingredients from such a skilled chef.Would highly recommend this class it was amazing.

reviews.title: A great experience
reviews.text: The walk around the market was fascinating and gave a real insight into how to select fish. In addition we learned a lot about local produceThe cooking course itself have a real insight into the world of a Chef. The food we produced and ate at the end was deliciousHector is an interesting man and well worth talking to about a range of subjectsWhy 4 Stars and not 5? I felt that more time could have been spent explaining what was being done and requiredWould I do it again. Definite

reviews.title: A MUST!
reviews.text: If you want a unique Peruvian experience, BOOK THIS. It was my birthday and Maido made sure that I had the best day I could wish for.It started with the market visit, and he gave such a detailed history on Peruvian food which made it much more interesting.Then we got to cook outside on this beautiful terrace in front of the historical site Sitio Huaca Pucllana. I would definitely recommend if you want to do something more than just visit. PLUS the food was amazing.

reviews.title: A perfect experience!
reviews.text: Thhis was simply an amazing experience! The chef picked us up and took us to a market where we had a wonderful tour and a special ceviche prepared for us. Chef Hector is super smart, funny and highly creative. Back at the school we were guided through the process of making several dishes. All was done with humor and kindness. All 3 of us are pretty good cooks but we still learned so much! We concluded with sharing this fabulous meal. It was a lot of fun and very instructive. I might add that the view from the rooftop school is fantastic!

reviews.title: Outstanding Cooking Class + Fishmarkt visit in Lima – An Unforgettable Experience!
reviews.text: Outstanding Cooking Class + Fishmarket visit in Lima – An Unforgettable Experience!This cooking class was simply exceptional! Our adventure began as early as 4 AM with a visit to the fish market, where we selected the freshest fish and seafood for our meal later in the day. The entire experience was flawlessly organized, everything ran smoothly, and the passion behind it was truly evident.What impressed me the most was the warm, family-like atmosphere – you instantly feel welcome and well taken care of. But the absolute highlight was, of course, the food: The fish and seafood were of a quality I had never experienced before. Even though I usually don’t eat much seafood, this meal was simply spectacular – fresh, perfectly prepared, and incredibly flavorful.This cooking class is an absolute must for anyone visiting Lima who wants to experience something truly special in the culinary world!

reviews.title: great class and tour
reviews.text: amazing class，The atmosphere is relaxed and fun, and the food is delicious. Hector is an amazing chef and taught us a lot.

reviews.title: Fantastic Experience
reviews.text: It was a fantastic experience from the moment we booked, the communication and coordination prior to our arrival, the market visit and cooking class, the FOOD, and continuing through to the afterglow we felt when it was all over… or was that the chilcanos and pisco sours?  Either way, we could not have been happier. Our family of five arrived in Lima late in the evening, including three twenty something children, and we were looking forward to starting our exploration of Perú. Hector was an excellent guide on our journey and if we could give this 6 stars we would!  The food was amazing and the class was a hands on experience like no other. We learned new techniques and experienced flavors and textures galore. It was a great first day in Lima where food was the vehicle through which we learned about the history, dynamic culture and fusion of cultures which is Perú.

reviews.title: A unique, fun, and tasty experience
reviews.text: I highly recommend this class. Market shopping and cooking with Hector is like hanging out with an old friend...if your friend was an insanely good chef!  Everyone had a great time, great views (rooftop kitchen), and no-one went hungry -- there was enough for 3 extra people! This is a unique and fun experience.

reviews.title: Absolutely great, worth it. This is the class you want to book
reviews.text: Had a wonderful cooking class with Ricardo and Hector. Because of a strike, my visit to the market was shorter but worth it. From the pick up to my hotel to the food and the patience to answer all my questions, everything was greatI cook a lot at home but Peruvian food is mostly new to me so I learned a lot during the class to hopefully reproduce at home some of the dishes I’ve eaten since my arrival in Lima a few days before

reviews.title: From culinary novices to Nikkei ninjas in a day!
reviews.text: From culinary novices to Nikkei ninjas in a day! Our Lima cooking class was a blast. We learned to make Nikkei-style tiraditos (Peruvian-Japanese fusion, think sashimi with amazing sauces), and Chef Hector and his partner exceeded expectations. After picking out fresh fish at the market, we headed to a terrace overlooking Inca ruins for a step-by-step lesson in sauces and dishes.Thank you for sharing your secret recipes! We’re already making them at home, along with the Chilcano cocktail Ricardo taught us—Pisco, bitters, ginger soda, and fresh ginger juice. A fun, informative, and unforgettable experience!
